intro: Gigachilon polonicum subsp. turanicum, commonly known as the Turanian giant sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and similar plants. The plant is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as wet meadows and marshy areas. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological role in wetland ecosystems.
